title: American Airlines Spells Out the Cost of Boeing MAX Jet’s Grounding
text:
American Airlines Group said it canceled 9,475 flights in the third quarter due to the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX jet. Those cancellations hurt pretax income by $140 million, and the bill for the full year will be more than half a billion dollars.

The company’s adjusted quarterly earnings were still better than Wall Street expected. American Airlines stock (ticker: AAL) initially inched down, but rose 2% to $28.90 as management discussed the results with investors on a conference call.

description: The grounding of Boeing’s 737 MAX jet will cost American Airlines more than half a billion dollars in pretax income this year, the carrier said as it reported better-than-expected quarterly profits.
